Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.model.entity

Class Transaction

java.lang.Object
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.model.entity.BaseEntity
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.model.entity.Transaction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Identifiable<Long>
@Entity public class Transaction extends BaseEntity
Financial transaction entity that represent an income or an expense. It try to be simple and a bit normalized so data dont go messy over time.

Persistence details

  • Indexed by date, type and category for common lookup that happen a lot.
  • DB constraint amount &gt;= 0 so we dont store negative money by accident.
  • category is ManyToOne and lazy-loaded.

Normalization

  • setDescription(String) trims extra spaces around (so UI look cleaner).
  • setAmount(double) turns negatives into absolute value; not super smart but work.

    • getDate

      public LocalDate getDate()
      Return the accounting date for this movement.
      Returns:
      the date; once persisted should not be null

    • setDate

      public void setDate(LocalDate date)
      Set the accounting date. Must be a real date; passing null will compile but break logic later.
      Parameters:
      date - new date value, please not null

    • getAmount

      public double getAmount()
      Return the non-negative amount (currency is implied by app).
      Returns:
      the amount currently stored

    • setAmount

      public void setAmount(double amount)
      Set the amount; negative inputs are made absolute. It is a bit opinionated but avoid weird minus on expenses/incomes mixing.
      Parameters:
      amount - the numeric value, negatives will become positive

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Return the normalized description (trimmed text).
      Returns:
      description string, can be null before validation

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(String description)
      Set the free-text description; surrounding whitespace are removed.
      Parameters:
      description - any text; null stays null, otherwise trimmed

    • getType

      public TransactionType getType()
      Return the transaction type (like INCOME or EXPENSE).
      Returns:
      current TransactionType

      public void setType(TransactionType type)
      Set the transaction type; should not be null or behaviour goes wierd.
      Parameters:
      type - the kind of movement to store
